titles.title: To take certain Federal lands located in Tulare County, California, into trust for the benefit of the Tule River Indian Tribe, and for other purposes.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 114-649.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 501.

action.text: Mr. Hice, Jody B. moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4685.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 114-538.

committee.subcommittee: Indigenous Peoples of the United States
committee.name: House Natural Resources

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House reported version is repeated here.)
Tule River Indian Reservation Land Trust, Health, and Economic Development Act
(Sec. 2) This bill takes into trust 34 acres of federal land in Tulare County, California, for the benefit of the Tule River Indian Tribe. Gaming is prohibited on this land.
Persons claiming valid, existing rights to the land taken into trust may apply to the Department of the Interior to have those rights converted to a long-term right-of-way.
